DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Global Response Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the chronic graft versus host disease global response based on clinician assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Global Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Covering or affecting the whole of a system._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Covering or affecting the whole of a system.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Covering or affecting the whole of a system.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR 16C0094 study as requested by P.Asangong. mc 4/25/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinician overall severity score 0 following GvHD response.

Concepts.definition: A clinician overall severity score 0 following GvHD response.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinician overall severity score decreases by 2 or more points on a 0-10 scale

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinician overall severity score decreases by 2 or more points on a 0-10 scale
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinician overall severity score that has decreased by 2 or more points on a 0-10 scale.

Concepts.definition: A clinician overall severity score that has decreased by 2 or more points on a 0-10 scale.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinician overall severity score increases by 2 or more points on a 0-10 scale

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinician overall severity score increases by 2 or more points on a 0-10 scale
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinician overall severity score that has increased by 2 or more points on a 0-10 scale.

Concepts.definition: A clinician overall severity score that has increased by 2 or more points on a 0-10 scale.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for CCR 16C0094 study as requested by P.Asangong. mc 4/25/16
